title: Angular momentum - L-t graph for a momentum wheel

content.question: A momentum wheel is a rotating wheel aboard a satellite used to control the angular orientation of the satellite. Engineers who are testing a momentum wheel on Earth apply a time-varying torque to the wheel and determine the wheel’s resulting angular momentum. The graph shows the wheel’s angular momentum as a function of time during one of the tests. For which of the following time intervals did the torque on the wheel change by the greatest amount?

choices.label: Between <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> seconds
Between <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> seconds
Between <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> and <math alttext="9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> seconds
Between <math alttext="9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> and <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>11</mn></math> seconds

content.answer: Between <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> seconds

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
